name: SodaStream
description: Home carbonation product company that operates a factory in the West Bank.
reasons: Previously operated a factory in Mishor Adumim industrial zone in the occupied West Bank until 2015
Now operates in Lehavim, in the Naqab (Negev) where Palestinian Bedouins face forced displacement
Parent company PepsiCo continues to profit from business activities in Israel despite human rights concerns

alternatives.name: DrinkMate
alternatives.description: Alternative carbonation system without controversial ties

alternatives.name: Aarke
alternatives.description: Swedish-designed carbonator with ethical manufacturing

name: Sabra
description: Hummus and dip manufacturer partially owned by the Strauss Group.
reasons: 50% owned by Strauss Group, an Israeli food company that provides support to the Golani Brigade of the Israeli military
The Golani Brigade has been documented committing human rights abuses in Gaza and the West Bank
Manufacturing facilities operate on land with disputed ownership claims

alternatives.name: Cedar's
alternatives.description: Mediterranean foods company with ethical sourcing

alternatives.name: Ithaca Hummus
alternatives.description: Small-batch hummus with transparent supply chain

name: Pillsbury
description: Food company with manufacturing in Israeli settlements.
reasons: Operates a factory in the Atarot Industrial Zone in occupied East Jerusalem on confiscated Palestinian land
Parent company General Mills has continued operations in illegal settlements despite international criticism
Products are manufactured using resources from occupied territory in violation of international law

alternatives.name: Bob's Red Mill
alternatives.description: Employee-owned baking products company with ethical practices

alternatives.name: King Arthur Flour
alternatives.description: Employee-owned baking company with transparent supply chain

name: Coca-Cola
description: Beverage company with operations and investments in Israel.
reasons: Operates a bottling plant in Ashkelon on land that previously belonged to the Palestinian village of al-Jura
Subsidiary Coca-Cola Israel operates in illegal Israeli settlements and maintains distribution centers on occupied land
Has invested over $85 million in Israel despite international calls for divestment due to human rights concerns

alternatives.name: Boylan Bottling
alternatives.description: Independent craft soda producer with ethical sourcing

alternatives.name: Fever-Tree
alternatives.description: Premium mixer company with transparent supply chains

name: Nestlé
description: Food conglomerate with significant operations in Israel.
reasons: Operates a major factory near Sderot in Israel on land that belonged to the Palestinian village of Najd
Continues to expand operations in Israel including partnerships with Israeli tech companies in disputed territories
Sources ingredients from farms on illegally occupied Palestinian land

alternatives.name: Equal Exchange
alternatives.description: Worker-owned fair trade food company

alternatives.name: Newman's Own
alternatives.description: Food company that donates profits to charity

name: McDonald's
description: Fast food chain with significant presence in Israel.
reasons: Franchises operating in contested territories
Support for Israeli military operations through meal donations

description: Beverage company with extensive operations in Israel.

Owns SodaStream which has a factory in the West Bank
